channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: On 03/09/24 at 23:35pm There was a arson attack on a vehicle parked in lavington close car park bay L57.Two white males early 20s set fire to this blue ford GJ20 KLD vehicle with a petrol can pouring flammable liquid down the side of the driver's side door then igniting car inflames.Two males fled the scene running off after arson attack.Homerton fire brigade department attended scene and put fire out on vehicle. Firefighter stated the fire had been started,caused deliberately. Firefighter reported incident to metropolitan police to attend for investigation.Territorial police group unit 334 attended levington close .This whole event caused distress and disturbance to surrounding neighbours.Police were knocking on resident Door early hours in the morning asking if they've seen anything. Police looking for possible evidence and CCTV.An arson attack is the criminal and malicious act of intentionally starting a fire to damage or destroy property, which can include buildings, vehicles, or even forests. This act causes criminal damage, with potential consequences ranging from significant financial losses and injury to homelessness, or even death. Arsonists often use accelerants like petrol and may have motives such as vandalism, insurance fraud, or revenge, though some individuals may have impulse control disorders or pyromania.Residents are seriously concerned with incident of premeditated fire arson attack on a car has caused fear & distress to surrounding neighbours. Residence had to close all windows doors/cover wall filter air vents due to smoke coming into property causing them to cough and get health problems inhaling the smoke. Residents are in fear/scared if these two males are capable of doing this imagine it was somebody's home or the car fire escalated to burning someone's home. This needs to be taken seriously an investigated. Hackney Council and authority need to do their duty to safeguard Residence and members of public this is not on. The mayor of Hackney. The metropolitan police commissioner. Get your act together and serve the community., 5th September
item.description:
Residence car set on fire deliberately. Antisocial behaviour.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lavington Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nearly all street lights on Court Downs Road not working, 5th September
item.description:
I have been arriving home from work this week in the dark and nearly all of the street lights on Court Downs Road are not working (I think I counted 2 that were working). There are parts of Court Downs Road (specifically down near Kelsey Park) where the path is heavily covered by trees, so it's very dark without the street lights working. This could cause people to feel unsafe, and also create more slip and trip hazards.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The East Heath car park exit has no accessible ramp for wheelchair users. My wife who drives her own car from her powerchair is amost thrown from her chair, 5th September
item.description:
There is no ramp or level access at the exit to the East Heath car park opposite Downshire Hill. The height of the paving stone is about 2 inches. So my wife who is disabled and drives her own adapted car from her powerchair has to negotiate this 2 inch drop and is nearly thrown from her chair as a result. The exit is next to the disabled bays so it is imperative that a simple ramp is installed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downshire Hill, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite 82 Piccadilly (on the side of Green Park Station) - abandoned silver bicycle frame only attracted to railings. No seats, no wheel. Next time Street sweeper euro bins.
